intro: Geranium chilense, commonly known as the Chilean geranium, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically features heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Geranium chilense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and natural habitats across its native range. It is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
